page.title: 11Stetchworth Traditions
page.content: Our only tradition in Stetchworth is on May Day.Children used to go round with a wreath of May flowers and knock on people's doors and sing a song.They would be given money.Now every year the children in the infant class at Stetchworth act out a short play about Winter giving way to Spring.After the play the infants give out flowers they have bought in.They also go to Jubilee Court,the old people's home,and act the play. Instead of giving flowers to them there they leave them on their doorstep. After the play they sing a song which is the same each year but is not the song which used to be sung in the village.
